children.name: bride b1
children.definition: bride the woman who is getting married: cô dâu
examples: everyone turned around as the bride entered the church.
teenage brides are twice as likely to end up being divorced as women who marry later.
he took his young bride to live on the ranch in wyoming.
he returned from new york with his lovelynewbride.
the brideand groomposed for pictures outside the church.
as themother of thebride, i feel obliged to wear something really spectacular.

children.name: groom b1
children.definition: groom/ bridegroom the man who is getting married: chú rể
examples: it is traditional for the groom to buy presents for the bridesmaids.
can i take a photograph of the bride and groom?
the bridegroom was late for the ceremony.
thebride andgroom walked down the aisle together.

children.name: bridesmaid x
children.definition: bridesmaid one of the women who help the bride on her wedding day, and who stand with her during the ceremony: phù dâu
examples: my three sisters were bridesmaids for me.

children.name: best man x
children.definition: best man the chief man who helps the groom on his wedding day, and who stands with him during the ceremony: phù rể chính
examples: i was honoured that he asked me to be his best man.

children.name: the happy couple b1
children.definition: the happy couple informal a man and a woman who have just got married:
examples: i’d like to propose a toast to the happy couple.
everyone waved goodbye as the happy couple drove away.

children.name: matron of honour x
children.definition: matron of honour/matron of honor  the chief married woman who helps the bride on the day of her wedding, and who stands with her during the ceremony: bà phù dâu
examples: i asked my older sister, louise, to be my matron of honor.

children.name: maid of honour x
children.definition: maid of honour /maid of honor  the chief unmarried woman who helps the bride on the day of her wedding and who stands with her during the ceremony: cô phù dâu chính
examples: leslie couldn’t decide which of her college friends she wanted for her maid of honor.

children.name: groomsman x
children.definition: groomsman  one of the men who help the groom on his wedding day, and who stand with him during the ceremony: phù rể
examples: we need one groomsman for each bridesmaid.

children.name: wife a1
children.definition: wife the woman that a man is married to:
examples: my wife’s career is very important to her.
have you met the ambassador’s wife?
first/ second etc wife
he remarried after his first wife died of cancer.

children.name: husband a1
children.definition: husband the man that a woman is married to:
examples: i don’t like francesca’s husband very much.
how many husbands would stay at home and take care of the children while their wife goes out to work?
first/ second etc husband
gary’s her second husband

children.name: partner b1
children.definition: partner the person that sb lives with in a romantic relationship - use this whether they are married or not: bạn đời
examples: have you met my partner, ray?
the office party is on friday, but partners aren’t invited.

children.name: couple c2
children.definition: couple two people who are married to each other, or who are having a romantic relationship: cặp đôi
examples: an elderly couple live next door.
they’re a nice couple, aren’t they?
married couple[more specific]
shirley and bob are a young married couple with two small children.

children.name: spouse c2
children.definition: spouse  formal the man or woman that someone is married to - use this in legal or official contexts:
examples: you may choose to pay income tax jointly or separately from your spouse.
in 60% of the households surveyed both spouses went out to work.

children.name: newlyweds x
children.definition: newlyweds a man and woman who have recently married: vợ chồng mới cưới
examples: everyone left at about midnight, leaving the newlyweds alone at last.
the hotel seemed to be full of newlyweds.
the hotel has a special discount rate for newlyweds.

children.name: man and wife x
children.definition: man and wife formal  a married couple:
examples: live as man and wife
terry and meena aren’t married but they live together as man and wife.
pronounce somebody man and wife
say that two people are officially married
i now pronounce you man and wife (= you are now officially married ) .
mom burst into tears as the minister pronounced us man and wife.

children.name: ask sb to marry you u
children.definition: ask sb to marry you
examples: don’t tell anyone, but timothy has asked me to marry him.
are you asking me to marry you?

children.name: propose b2
children.definition: propose formal to ask sb to marry you: cầu hôn
examples: did he get down on one knee to propose?
propose to
i thought he was going to propose to me, but in fact he just wanted to borrow some money.
i remember the night your father proposedtome.
proposal[c noun] [b2] an offer of marriage : lời cầu hôn
two days after their first meeting, tom made anna an official proposal of marriage. he formally proposed .

children.name: pop the question x
children.definition: pop the question informal to ask sb to marry you: dạm hỏi
examples: jane was delighted when matt eventually popped the question.
so did he pop the question, then?

children.name: eremonies, celebrations etc when people get married
wedding b1
children.definition: wedding an official ceremony at which two people get married, especially a religious ceremony: lễ cưới
examples: mom always cries at weddings.
after the wedding the bride and groom went straight to the airport for their flight to fiji.
white wedding[uk] a marriage ceremony in a church in which the woman wears a white dress : đám cưới trắng
are you going to have a traditional white wedding?
shotgun wedding[(us alsoshotgun marriage) old-fashioned informal] a marriage which is arranged very quickly and suddenly because the woman is pregnant : đám cưới gấp rút vì cô dâu đã mang thai
wedding ring/ ceremony/ invitation etc
have you sent out the wedding invitations yet?

children.name: honeymoon b1
children.definition: honeymoon a holiday that two people go on when they have just got married: tuần trăng mật
examples: we’re thinking of going to barbados for our honeymoon.
on (your) honeymoon
we came to paris on our honeymoon, and fell in love with the place.
honeymoon couple
the maldives is a popular destination for honeymoon couple

children.name: marriage b1
children.definition: marriage the ceremony at which two people are legally married, whether it involves religion or not:
examples: city hall keeps a record of all the births, deaths and marriages in the county.
the marriage took place without the bride’s parents’ consent.
they had a long andhappymarriage.
marriage certificate/ licence
we had to bring our marriage certificate to prove that we are married.

children.name: reception x
children.definition: reception an event that follows a wedding ceremony in which there is a meal, speeches, and sometimes dancing: hậu tiệc cưới
examples: we had our wedding reception in a local hotel.
i went to the church service, but not to the reception.
wedding reception[more specific]
the wedding will be held at st martin's church and the wedding reception at crathorne hotel.

children.name: stag night x
children.definition: stag night/ party (us alsobachelor party, australianbucks party) a party for a man and his male friends just before he gets married: tiệc chia tay cuộc sống độc thân
examples: it’s the best man’s job to arrange the groom’s stag night.
this is the club where john f. kennedy had his bachelor party.

children.name: bridal shower x
children.definition: shower/ bridal shower  a party for a woman and her female friends just before she gets married, when her friends give her gifts: tiệc chia tay cuộc sống độc thân
examples: melissa ended up getting three blenders at her bridal shower.
i bought the cutest baby clothes to take to jacey'sbabyshower.
hen night/ hen party[c noun] [uk] a party for a woman and her female friends just before she gets married:
it’s traditional to wear a silly hat on your hen night.

children.name: find a husband or wife for sb
marry off x
children.definition: marry off to find a husband or wife for your child, especially your daughter, because this is convenient for you: gả
examples: marry off sb/ marry sb off
if they couldn’t marry ellen off before her 21st birthday, nobody would marry her.
my uncle married off my cousin when she was 16.
marry sb off to sb
because of the scandal roberta was married off to a stranger and sent away from rome.
she was married offtothe local doctor by the age of sixteen.

children.name: arranged marriage x
children.definition: arranged marriage a marriage in which the parents choose a husband or wife for their child, especially because this is the custom in their society: hôn nhân sắp đặt
examples: vikram’s parents have organized an arranged marriage for him in india but he already has a girlfriend here.
in an arranged marriage the husband often insists that the wife brings a dowry.

children.name: sb you are going to marry
fiancé x
children.definition: fiancé the man that you are going to get married to:
examples: i’d like you to meet janice, my fiancée.
she didn’t know henry was marie’s fiancé.

children.name: husband-to-be u
children.definition: husband-to-be a man who is soon going to be married, used especially when you are talking about the plans for the wedding ceremony:
examples: it’s understandable if the husband-to-be feels nervous before the ceremony.

children.name: bride-to-be x
children.definition: bride-to-be a woman who is soon going to be married, used especially when you are talking about the plans for the wedding ceremony:
examples: the magazine is aimed mainly at brides-to-be.

children.name: fiancée x
children.definition: fiancée the woman that you are going to get married to:
examples: i’d like you to meet janice, my fiancée.
she didn’t know henry was marie’s fiancé.

children.name: marry x
children.definition: marry làm lễ cưới, làm phép cưới (cho một cặp vợ chồng)
examples: the priest who married us forgot his lines during the ceremony.
mum and dad fell in love on the cruise and were married by the ship’s captain.
the couple were married by the archbishop of canterbury .
